titleStmt.title: Description of British Library, Add MS 26883: Tefilot ῾al derekh ha-ḳabalah (תפלות על דרך הקבלה)

notesStmt.note: Edges very dark, a few tears at outer end.
Liquid (glue) and ink stains on verso.
Ink with some losses to abrasion or flaking, first few lines illegible.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Tefilot ῾al derekh ha-ḳabalah (תפלות על דרך הקבלה)

layoutDesc.layout: Columns: 1; ruled lines: 300; written lines: 300 ; Uniform layout. Ruling by hard point. Visible pricking and stiching. Larger initial words. Partly vocalised. One column written from top to bottom of the scroll. Wooden roller (270mm high).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian square script of the 15th century.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Dr M. Heidenheim: purchased from him by the British Museum on 23 September 1865: inscribed on verso.
